alert.note: Alert for Riverside (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 08 at 11:47AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following counties, Riverside and San Diego. * WHEN...Until 145 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1147 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rain across eastern Inland Empire and northern San Diego County. Rainfall rates of 0.2 to 0.40 per hour. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Minor mud flows on Fairview fire scar east of Hemet. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Moreno Valley, Oceanside, Carlsbad, Temecula, Vista, Encinitas, Lake Elsinore, Poway, Palm Springs and Ramona. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
